programme.desc: Jess Roy travels to each of the ACC college towns to showcase the interesting aspects of the universities, including the historical spots that further elaborate the school's rich history, along with the most popular restaurants and establishments.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Virginia claimed a 73-65 victory over Virginia Tech in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 16, led by a 24-point, 15-rebound performance from Latasha Lattimore; Rose Micheaux posted 15 points and 9 rebounds for the Hokies in the loss.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed a 90-79 victory over California in their last meeting on Nov. 12, 2022, led by a combined 31 points from Dara Mabrey and Kylee Watson; Jayda Curry posted 24 points and 5 assists for the Golden Bears in the defeat.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Notre Dame claimed a 90-79 victory over California in their last meeting on Nov. 12, 2022, led by a combined 31 points from Dara Mabrey and Kylee Watson; Jayda Curry posted 24 points and 5 assists for the Golden Bears in the defeat.

programme.title: College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Clemson claimed a 197.350-195.550 victory over North Carolina in their lone meeting from the 2024 season on Feb. 23, behind a 49.600 on floor; the Tigers closed out the win with a 49.300 in their final rotation to the Tar Heels' 48.975.

programme.title: ACCN Documentary
programme.desc: All-access footage of the Clemson, Pittsburgh, NC State and North Carolina gymnastics teams showcases their pursuit of the first conference championship in 40 years, featuring coaches wired for sound and the amount of work it takes for the athletes.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: When Indiana native Everett Case arrives in Raleigh to become the coach at North Carolina State, his vision spearheads not just the rise of college basketball at his school and in the region, but the start of a conference that will change the sport.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: From Frank McGuire to Bones McKinney and Vic Bubas, new coaches emerge to challenge the early success of Everett Case. It all precedes a final poignant moment of triumph for Case at the only home the ACC Tournament has, until this point, ever known.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: After a rough start, North Carolina's Dean Smith comes to be known for both dominance and dignity, playing a central role in desegregating the ACC with the recruitment of Charlie Scott, who emerges as a star on some of Smith's greatest teams.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: An intense and high-impact rivalry develops between Maryland and North Carolina State, capped by the finale of the 1974 ACC Tournament in arguably the greatest college basketball game ever - and a battle that helps shape the future of the sport.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: Dean Smith's North Carolina teams may be the class of the ACC, but rivals also flourish, including a Virginia team led by Wally Walker, and a Duke program that re-emerges with a championship run in 1978 and a controversial title two years later.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: Virginia's Ralph Sampson earns national player of the year honors three times, but never wins the ACC Tournament. Dean Smith seeks a title with freshman Michael Jordan, and the charismatic Jim Valvano leads NC State on a memorable Cinderella run.

programme.title: The Tournament: A History of ACC Men's Basketball
programme.desc: After previous ACC Tournament heartbreaks, Maryland's Lefty Driesell and Georgia Tech's Bobby Cremins both seek redemption. All the while, Mike Krzyzewski survives early calls for his job and helps turn up the heat on the Duke-Carolina rivalry.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wake Forest (17-6, 9-3) won eight of its last 10 behind Hunter Sallis, who is tied for third in the ACC in scoring with 18.3 ppg; Cal (12-11, 5-7) is 10-4 at home this season behind Andrej Stojakovic, who is also tied for third with 18.3 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Miami (5-17, 1-10) ended a 10-game skid with a 63-57 win over Notre Dame; Louisville (17-6, 10-2) won 11 of its last 12 games behind Chucky Hepburn, who leads the Cardinals in scoring with 15 ppg, and beat the Hurricanes last season, 80-71.

programme.title: ACC PM
programme.desc: Football show analyzing the biggest storylines from across the ACC, featuring big guest interviews and highlights from the best games; Hosted by Mark Packer, Taylor Tannebaum, and Tre Boston.

programme.title: Going Straight
programme.desc: Fletch's probation officer is disappointed that he hasn't found a job. Fletch plans to dig up some loot he buried in Essex before he went to prison, but there's a problem.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Alistair has specific instructions for Lionel to follow about his public image. So Lionel and Jean work on getting him a suitable outfit for his impending book launch.

programme.title: Sunset Song
programme.desc: The BBC's 1972 dramatisation of Lewis Grassic Gibbon's novel about a young girl's intellectual and sexual development within a repressive peasant community in Scotland just before the First World War. `But for all my reading and schooling, two Chris Guthries there were that fought for my heart and tormented me.'

programme.title: Sunset Song
programme.desc: `You knew you'd never be the same again, but the world went on, and you went with it. So you folded up your dreams and laid them away with the dark quiet corpse that was your childhood.'

programme.title: Sunset Song
programme.desc: `But a worse thing came as slow September dragged to its end. A thing I would never tell a soul. Festering away in the closet of my mind, the memory would lie until it died.'

programme.title: Scotland's Favourite Book
programme.desc: Following a public vote, Kirsty Wark reveals the top ten countdown leading to the nation's favourite book. Along the way, First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, Dame Evelyn Glennie, Sanjeev Kohli and Susan Calman are among the celebrities championing their personal favourite.

programme.title: 100 Years of BBC Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A young Liam Neeson retraces the growth and decline of Ulster's railway network, from its vital role in connecting communities to its eventual collapse due to the rise of cars.

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: A look at the construction of the Empire State Building in New York, which was the world's tallest skyscraper when opened in 1931. The programme investigates the building's history through interviews with the people who contributed to the construction of this iconic building.

programme.title: Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Chris Beardshaw helps a couple from the shingle headland at Dungeness, Kent, where the salt winds, poor soil and scorching sunlight are causing them difficulties. They visit Derek Jarman's garden nearby and Hyde Hall in Essex.

programme.title: Bruce Parry's Amazon
programme.desc: Bruce Parry travels through the jungles of Peru to visit the Achuar people, a remote tribe who are fighting to keep oil companies off their land. He undergoes a profound shamanic ritual in an effort to find his vision.

programme.title: An Evening With Nat King Cole

programme.title: Johnny Mathis: Tribute to Nat King Cole
programme.desc: A musical tribute to Nat King Cole with special guest Natalie Cole. Johnny Mathis recalls and sings the music of one of the greatest and most endearing musician-singers of the 20th century. From 1983.

programme.title: Natalie Cole in Concert
programme.desc: In a television special from 1990, American singer-songwriter Natalie Cole performs her greatest hits, including `Pink Cadillac', `I Live for Your Love', and `This Will Be'.

programme.desc: Acclaimed trumpeter/bandleader Wynton Marsalis and the Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra play a selection of classic tunes from the legendary American jazz label Blue Note.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn visits the Ribblehead Viaduct in the Yorkshire Dales, talks to the man who saved it from closure and tours the breathtaking stations of the Hungerbergbahn in Innsbruck.

programme.title: Flying Gardener
programme.desc: Britain's largest protected wetland; ponds filled with exotics.

programme.title: Tutankhamun in Colour
programme.desc: Oxford University Egyptologist, Elizabeth Frood, is our guide to the discovery of the tomb on 4 November 1922 by British Egyptologist Howard Carter and Lord Carnarvon. It provided much-needed good news, following the Great War and the Spanish Flu pandemic of 1919, and we have been transfixed ever since.

programme.title: Raiders of the Lost Past with Janina Ramirez
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez turns detective and heads to Egypt to uncover the real story of how Howard Carter unearthed a pharaoh's tomb when everyone else believed there were no more great Egyptian finds to be made. She discovers that some of Tutankhamun's treasures are missing and reveals the name of the person responsible. She delves into the origins of the supposed pharaoh's curse, and finds the truth about the king's brutal injuries.

programme.title: The Treasures of Tutankhamun
programme.desc: Magnus Magnusson's guide to the Egyptian king Tutankahmun's celebrated visit to a London museum in 1972.

programme.title: Tutankhamun's Egypt
programme.desc: From the famous 1972 Tutankhamun Exhibition at the British Museum, Cyril Aldred introduces a programme on the role of artists in ancient Egypt. Artists rarely signed their work and were considered primarily as craftsmen.

programme.title: Tutankhamun's Egypt
programme.desc: Cyril Aldred explores how important the army had become in New Kingdom times: Tutankhamun's two immediate successors on the throne of Egypt were both generals. Egypt's military and economic influence stretched from Nubia to Anatolia.

programme.title: Tutankhamun's Egypt
programme.desc: Cyril Aldred explores the religion of the ancient Egyptians, which appears both strange and exotic. There are a great number of gods, and many of them take animal forms, like baboons and ibises.

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles shows how 20th-century attention turned from civilisation and kings to the search for the common man against a background of science and competing political ideologies.

The last of Tottenham's eight FA Cup victories came in 1991, and like Villa, their last major trophy was the League Cup title in 2008.

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Weatherman Derek Brockway explores the stunning Wye Valley on a walk which takes him from the ancient village of Trellech to the stunning market town of Monmouth. On the way he takes a dip in `Britain's favourite river', the Wye, and follows in the footsteps of Admiral Nelson. Meanwhile history hunter Dr Erin Lloyd Jones joins the search for a lost city and Matthew Bassett forages the woods and hedgerows for some edible delights.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites

programme.desc: Andi is in Bristol to help Jasper Thompson, a local man whose pioneering homeless project transforms shipping containers into temporary accommodation. He wants to raise awareness about his new community café, so who better than Andi to help him.

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: A chasm appears in Andy and Jo's wheat field, single mum Sally pregnancy-scans her ewes, while the Imrie family discuss an events business set-up to take pressure off the farm.

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic
programme.desc: A faithful representation of the doomed Antarctic expedition of 1911-12 led by Captain Robert Falcon Scott. After much misfortune, the five-man team makes it to the South Pole through almost superhuman effort - only to find that the Norwegian flag is already flying. They then set out on the perilous return journey, but more disasters befall them.

programme.title: A Countryside Winter
programme.desc: Wildlife artist and cameraman Robert Fuller shows what wildlife species are thriving around his Yorkshire farm, and Sean Fletcher tries an extreme sport with a difference, winter cod fishing. Nigel Slater cooks up the perfect dish for a cold day, hearty stuffed squash.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness explores the secrets of the McColgan's bakery in Strabane, Northern Ireland, to reveal how it makes more than half a million sausage rolls a day.

programme.title: Ski Sunday
programme.desc: Ed Leigh and Chemmy Alcott are in the picturesque Austrian town of Saalbach for the opening week of the Alpine World Ski Championships. With extensive highlights from the men's and women's downhill races. Away from the competition, Jenny Jones meets a young woman who, after being diagnosed with a life-changing condition which left her unable to walk unaided, uses sit-skiing as proof that her condition doesn't define her.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Christina Trevanion visit the Fleet Air Arm Museum, and Paul travels to London to find out about the famous Somerset scientist Thomas Young, whose incredible all-round knowledge earned him the title of polymath.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Tucked away in the south east corner of Northern Ireland are the Mournes - a mountain range which stretches down to the coast. Matt Baker and Charlotte Smith uncover the threats the area faces.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: At Alexandra Gardens in Cardiff, highlights include some surprisingly valuable jewellery found at car boot sales, a jacket made by the Ojibwe people in Canada, and original illustrations of Peter Rabbit by Beatrix Potter.

programme.title: This Farming Life
programme.desc: The Imries wrestle stubborn pigs, while it's Nick's easycare sheep versus dad's trad breeds. On Papa Westray, Paul's ram has had a secret rendezvous with two ewes.

programme.title: Life and Death Row
programme.desc: After 20 years on death row, convicted murderer Ramiro Gonzales is scheduled for execution in June 2024. While one family hopes for a stay of execution, another longs for justice.

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In the Solent, one the busiest stretches of water in the UK, reports come in of a missing kite surfer. The crew of Lymington lifeboat station launch and start searching, but as the hours pass, they begin to fear the worst.

programme.title: Blue Velvet
programme.desc: When Jeffrey Beaumont discovers a severed ear in a field, his curiosity leads him into the world of extreme violence and weird sex controlled by Frank Booth, a criminal totally out of control, and Dorothy Vallens, a damsel in distress who seems to be in his thrall - or is she?

programme.title: The Elephant Man
programme.desc: Based on the life of John Merrick, a man born with a disfiguring disease who seemed doomed to a grim existence as a sideshow freak until taken in by a London surgeon and introduced to society. Despite his dreadful experiences, Merrick is a gentle, intelligent soul and becomes a popular guest in Victorian drawing rooms - but only if his deformed features are completely covered.

programme.title: The Elephant Man
programme.desc: Based on the life of John Merrick, a man born with a disfiguring disease who seemed doomed to a grim existence as a sideshow freak until taken in by a London surgeon and introduced to society. Despite his dreadful experiences, Merrick is a gentle, intelligent soul and becomes a popular guest in Victorian drawing rooms - but only if his deformed features are completely covered.

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Spanish Job
programme.desc: Amanda and Alan embark on their first room design as they renovate an open plan dining room and foyer. Alan's dreams of a reception area to receive their guests are quashed when Amanda suggests his special space should be a cupboard under the stairs.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an hour of topical debate from Glasgow. On the panel are Kate Forbes MSP, Michael Shanks MP, Russell Findlay MSP, Lorna Slater MSP and journalist Alex Massie.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When six people are slaughtered by an unknown gunman, Nikki and Jack must work against the clock to find the shooter. Can they find him in time before he kills again?

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: The Repair Shop: On the Road
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire - Crumbling York Minster Gets Rescued
programme.desc: The boys help save a monument that is crumbling before their eyes. Will brings a huge drum back to the barn, and Dom gets on the tools with the last scissor-maker in Sheffield.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion discovers the surprising value of the humble golf ball and learns about historic hickory golf clubs. John Cameron and Richard Madley, canter around the antiques fair at Linfield Park Racecourse in Surrey with the reds and blues.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team revives a torn, nicotine-stained lace dress that provided creative inspiration for a talented artist, and a battered drum that was once the heartbeat of a Cornish festival.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Edge
programme.desc: The game show that mixes general knowledge quizzing and bowling.

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the Boss and walk away with the cash? Only the strongest players will survive the game.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: They may be the most isolated in the world, but every one of the region's 20,000 islands has been colonised. This is the story of the ultimate castaways - from saltwater crocodiles and giant eels to crested iguanas - who have reached islands thousands of miles apart. The voyages of the South Pacific's first people, the Polynesians, were no less remarkable. Their journeys were some of the greatest ever undertaken.

programme.title: All Roads Lead Home
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan, Sue Perkins and Alison Steadman ditch their maps and compasses and attempt to travel the UK using nature as their only guide. Sue takes charge in Cornwall and leads Stephen and Alison from Bodmin Moor to Cape Cornwall. As amateur navigators, they soon discover that one wrong turn could mean disaster. Along the way, Sue takes to the skies and consults some wise women.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team are at Dover Castle in Kent. Antique experts James Lewis and Catherine Southon search for items to take off to auction. James unearths a silver owl inkwell and Catherine discovers an alabaster bust. Paul Martin delves into the history of the English Channel.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former players Gethin Jones, Tiff Stevenson, Kate Thornton and Gary Wilmot test their general knowledge skills on this week's Richard Osman's House of Games: Redemption Week.

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites Kacey Ainsworth for a weekend staycation in the north east of England. After a quick cup of tea, the pair head to the River Tyne to reset, recharge and revitalise themselves with a cold water swim before heading back to Robson's house.

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: The North Esk south of Edinburgh is a hidden gem. Paul follows it from the Pentland Hills through a landscape steeped in myth and legend. From the picturesque and delightful Habbie's Howe, he reaches Roslin Glen, which inspired some of our greatest artists and writers - especially the mysterious Rosslyn Chapel on the cliffs above. The power of the river was later harnessed for papermaking. Paul discovers the legacy of industry before heading to ancient Musselburgh on the coast near Edinburgh.

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts another heat of the classic quiz as four more contenders take on the black chair. The specialist subjects include Emmeline Pankhurst and David Tennant's years on Doctor Who.

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.sub-title: Semi Final - Four Opinions v Cat Cows
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the quiz where knowledge only gets you so far. It's semi-final time, and a coveted place in the third place play-off is at stake.

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: It's the first of the quarter-final matches. The teams are looking to pick up the first of the two wins they need to reach the semis. Amol Rajan asks the questions.

programme.title: The Balkans: Europe's Forgotten Frontier
programme.desc: Katya Adler travels to Romania, where she visits what will be Nato's largest European base, Kosovo, Europe's youngest country, and Serbia, where she discovers an international battle for power.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the N series, hosted by Sandi Toksvig, with Alan Davies and their guests.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: What's the Matter with Tony Slattery?
programme.desc: Tony Slattery was one of the most gifted TV comedians of the late 80s and early 90s. Then in 1996, amidst rumours of a massive breakdown, he seemed to vanish from screens overnight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 23 Illinois (15-8, 7-6) won the last seven meetings with the Golden Gophers after a 105-97 win last season; Minnesota (12-11, 4-8) is 10-5 at home behind Dawson Garcia, who is tied with Ace Bailey for the Big Ten scoring lead at 20.1 ppg.

programme.title: College Hockey
programme.desc: Michigan State and Michigan split wins in their first series of the season in Jan. with the Spartans claiming a 3-2 victory in the final matchup on Jan. 17; T.J. Hughes posted a goal and an assist for the Wolverines in the win at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Northwestern (13-10, 4-8) ended a three-game skid with a 77-75 win over USC behind 27 points from Nick Martinelli, who is third in the Big Ten with 19.7 ppg; Washington (11-11, 2-9) dropped seven of its last eight, but is 8-6 at home.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Coastal Escape

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing

programme.title: Pillow Fight Championship
programme.desc: The first professional international pillow fighting sports league, featuring accomplished MMA fighters competing in the men's and women's divisions using skill, strategy and agility to strike their opponent with the PFC Combat Pillow for the win.

programme.title: 30 for 30

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show

programme.title: The Racer
programme.desc: In the summer of 1998, the opening stages of the Tour de France are relocated to Ireland. Belgian Dom Chabol has been one of the best support riders for 20 years, a sacrificial role with victory never an option. But Dom secretly harbours a desire to wear the yellow jersey just once before his career is over. At the start of what will likely be his last Tour, Dom is unceremoniously dropped from the team he has dedicated his life to. As he gears up to go home and to face his estranged sister, a massive doping error knocks a team-mate off the Tour, and Dom is thrown back in the saddle. Sporting comedy drama, starring Louis Talpe and Matteo Simoni

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Following Neville's arrest on suspicion of killing David Cartwright, DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards arrives to investigate. CCTV footage shows an agitated Neville visiting the victim shortly before he was found dead, which as far as Flitcroft is concerned proves his guilt - so she advises the team members that if they are convinced of their inspector's innocence, they must prove it quickly. Robert Webb guests stars in the crime drama, with Ralf Little

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from both teams' second match in the championship, held at Scottish Gas Murrayfield Stadium. Ireland secured the title for a second successive year in 2023 with a 17-13 home win against Scotland in their final match. It was the Irish's 10th victory in a row over Scotland, but Gregor Townsend's men will be hopeful of at least pushing the champions close again this afternoon now they are on home territory. Jacqui Hurley presents, with analysis from Jamie Heaslip, Jim Hamilton and Stephen Ferris

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge worries that everyone thinks she is boring so she takes up lumberjacking, but when her talent takes her to Portland, Homer is not happy

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of how plant life turned Earth from a barren rock into a vibrant green world - a 4.5 billion-year saga of extraordinary highs and lows that almost wiped out all life. He reveals how a giant asteroid bombardment triggered Earth's plate tectonics, leading to huge fungi, soil and giant swamp forests, but the early plants locked in so much carbon dioxide that global temperatures suddenly plunged

programme.title: Big Cats 24/7
programme.desc: After a huge wildfire Gordon Buchanan and Vianet Djenguet follow the lion pride's dominant males Big Toe and Madumo as they reinstate their burnt-out boundaries and fight with intruder males. Brad Bestelink tracks Xudum the leopardess as she learns to hunt from trees after the fire wipes out her cover, while Anna Dimitriadis sticks with hungry resident cheetah Pobe day and night as she tries to hunt

programme.title: Hitler Youth
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the Nazi youth organisation, which was used to indoctrinate German boys in the 1930s and prepare them for the war Hitler was planning

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Detective Danny Frater arrives at the apartment where his estranged daughter Christina's body was found, and manages to get inside. As he carries out a search, he is startled to discover a young woman hiding in the bedroom. Although she does her best to escape, Danny manages to prevent her and forces her to answer his questions. She turns out to be Christina's wife, Nicola, and their subsequent conversation reveals as much about Danny's estrangement from his daughter as it does Christina's increasingly dark and complicated life

programme.title: Allianz League Sunday

programme.desc: As they bond over their shared love for the movie Dirty Dancing, Beverly is thrilled when Erica suggests the film as the theme for the upcoming school dance. However, Principal Ball refuses to sanction anything with the word 'dirty' in the title, threatening Erica with suspension if she persists with the idea. Barry lobbies for the dance to be based on his favourite movie Footloose, while Adam and Pops encourage Murray to learn to dance in order to make Beverly happy

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Stanley visits Piedmont, the region that made the dream of a unified Italy a reality. Once the engine room of Italian industrialisation, Piedmont is now spearheading a slow food revolution. Between reimagined risotto and the elusive white truffle, Stanley uncovers a region with an illustrious past but with its sights firmly set on the future

programme.title: The Jetty
programme.desc: Ember is forced to confess to her family that human bone fragments were found in the boat hut, but Hannah can't believe her dad was responsible and pleads with Ember to look further. When a new development propels Ember into dangerous territory, the truth is finally revealed, and it proves far more shocking than she ever expected

programme.title: First Dates Ireland

Sparks fly as Becky from Kilkenny finds the shy guy of her dreams in competitive gamer Aaron from Wexford, and gardener Ciarán from Kerry is paired with former Rose of Tralee contestant Hannah from Cork. Following a tumultuous date in the restaurant last year, Dublin bus driver Kevin regains his energy with canine-mad groomer Michelle from Waterford

programme.desc: Visually arresting thriller about a researcher who uses a mentally disabled gardener for ill-advised experiments in inducing mental development through virtual reality simulations. At first, the simulations seem to enhance the lawnmower man's mental powers, but then the experiment goes haywire. Based on a short story by Stephen King.

programme.title: The Lawnmower Man
programme.desc: Visually arresting thriller about a researcher who uses a mentally disabled gardener for ill-advised experiments in inducing mental development through virtual reality simulations. At first, the simulations seem to enhance the lawnmower man's mental powers, but then the experiment goes haywire. Based on a short story by Stephen King.

programme.title: 300: Rise of an Empire
programme.desc: Xerxes, driven by vengeance for his father's death, leads an army against Greece. Greek city-states join forces under Athens' command to fight Artemisia in a naval battle.

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Following the death of his friend, Bobby decides to leave the army, but he is soon asked to come back into action in order to help prevent the assassination of the President.

programme.title: The Equalizer 3
programme.desc: Finding himself at home in Southern Italy, former operative Robert McCall soon discovers his new friends are under the control of local crime bosses. As events turn deadly, McCall becomes their protector by taking on the mafia.

programme.title: John Wick
programme.desc: When sadistic mobster Iosef Tarasov and his thugs steal John Wick's prized car, and kill the puppy that was a last gift from his beloved late wife, John unleashes the remorseless killing machine within and seeks vengeance.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: Retired super-assassin John Wick's plans to resume a quiet civilian life are cut short when Italian gangster Santino D'Antonio shows up on his doorstep with a gold marker, compelling him to repay past favours. Ordered by Winston, the kingpin of secret assassin society The Continental, to respect the organisation's ancient code, Wick reluctantly accepts the assignment to travel to Rome to take out D'Antonio's sister, the ruthless capo atop the Italian Camorra crime syndicate.

programme.title: The Adventures of Tom Thumb & Thumbelina
programme.desc: Two infants are abducted from the kingdom of little people in the heart of the magical forest, and taken away with a travelling circus. The boy, Tom Thumb, manages to escape, but Thumbelina is left captive. When she breaks free, she bumps into Tom Thumb, who she doesn't recognise except for noticing that he is also only six inches tall.

programme.title: The Swan Princess: The Secret of the Castle
programme.desc: A princess and prince's wedding anniversary celebrations are rudely interrupted by an evil wizard, who once again wants to conquer the world.

programme.title: The Swan Princess
programme.desc: A beautiful princess falls in love with a prince from another land, but an exiled magician who wants her for himself conjures up a spell to transform her into a swan. Forced to embark on a dangerous quest to reverse the magic, the princess is helped along by some new-found animal friends.

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Mechs vs. Mutants
programme.desc: Gotham City faces catastrophe when Mr Freeze transforms Killer Croc and Bane into mega-sized mutant monsters. As the gigantic villains go on the rampage, it's up to the caped crusader to cut them down to size.

programme.title: Pil's Adventures
programme.desc: Pil, a little orphan, lives in the streets of the city of Roc-en-Brume. With her three tamed weasels, she survives by stealing food from the castle of the sinister regent who usurps the throne.

programme.title: Pil's Adventures

programme.title: Paws of Fury: The Legend of Hank
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck hound finds himself in a town full of cats who need a hero to defend them from a ruthless villain's evil plot. With help from a reluctant trainer, the underdog must assume the role of fearsome samurai and save the day.

programme.title: Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
programme.desc: Story of the chase for a giant rabbit terrorising a town's allotments and vegetable patches days before the annual vegetable-growing competition. As Wallace and his trusty companion are called into action with their pest control business, a dastardly Lord Victor Quartermaine competes to capture the Were-Rabbit and win the heart of a beautiful lady.

programme.title: Despicable Me 3
programme.desc: After being fired from the `Anti-Villain League', a man travels to Freedonia to meet his long-lost twin brother. Once united the siblings find themselves on a mission to take down a former child star from the 1980s, now out for revenge.

programme.title: Despicable Me 3
programme.desc: After being fired from the `Anti-Villain League', a man travels to Freedonia to meet his long-lost twin brother. Once united the siblings find themselves on a mission to take down a former child star from the 1980s, now out for revenge.

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: The sequel to `Madagascar', in which New York Zoo animals, Alex the Lion, Marty the Zebra, Melman the Giraffe and Gloria the Hippo, still stranded on Madagascar, start to leave the island. All of a sudden, they land in the wilderness of Africa, where Alex meets the rest of his family, but has trouble communicating with them after spending so much time at the Central Park Zoo. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted
programme.desc: Melman, Alex, Marty and Gloria are back and still trying to make it back to New York. When their journey brings them to Europe, they use a travelling circus as the perfect cover. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Home
programme.desc: When an alien race called the Boov move to Earth to escape from their enemies, the Gorg, humans are all removed from their homes and put in Happy Humans camps. One of the aliens, a friendly chap named `Oh', isn't like the other Boov, who dislike wasting time and never make mistakes. When Oh accidentally lets the Gorg know that the Boov are hiding on Earth, the other Boov are furious and he begins life on the run, making friends with a human girl and trying to help her find her mum.

programme.title: Antz
programme.desc: A neurotic ant struggles to express his individuality in a colony of conformists. He attempts to break from his totalitarian society while at the same time trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: The imprisoned god of war, Ares, escapes captivity with the intent to destroy Earth. Diana, an Amazonian warrior, teams up with Steve Trevor, recapture the deity.

programme.title: The Canterville Ghost
programme.desc: Sir Simon de Canterville has been haunting the grounds of his country estate for more than 300 years, but he soon meets his match when he tries to scare off a modern-day American family that just moved in.

programme.title: The LEGO Batman Movie
programme.desc: There are big changes brewing in Gotham, but if Batman wants to save the city from the Joker's hostile takeover, he may have to drop the lone vigilante thing, try to work with others and maybe, just maybe, learn to lighten up.

programme.title: The Emoji Movie
programme.desc: A multi-expression emoji, gets sentenced to be deleted after he messes up a message his user sent to his crush. Gene escapes the agents sent to destroy him and accepts his uniqueness.

programme.title: Mr. Peabody & Sherman
programme.desc: Mr Peabody, the most accomplished canine in the world, and his boy, Sherman, use a time machine called the Wabac to embark on outrageous adventures. However, when Sherman takes the Wabac without permission to impress his friend Penny, he accidentally rips a hole in the universe and causes havoc with world history. It's up to Mr Peabody to mount a rescue and prevent the past, present and future from being permanently altered. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Mr. Peabody & Sherman
programme.desc: Mr Peabody, the most accomplished canine in the world, and his boy, Sherman, use a time machine called the Wabac to embark on outrageous adventures. However, when Sherman takes the Wabac without permission to impress his friend Penny, he accidentally rips a hole in the universe and causes havoc with world history. It's up to Mr Peabody to mount a rescue and prevent the past, present and future from being permanently altered. A DreamWorks animation.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 3: A Monster Vacation
programme.desc: Mavis surprises Dracula with plans for a fun-filled summer voyage on a monster cruise. As the pack starts enjoying colossal buffets and exotic excursions, Drac finds himself falling for the ship's intriguing but dangerous captain. He soon learns that trying to balance family, friends and romance might just be too much to handle. even for the world's most powerful vampire.

programme.title: Rock Dog
programme.desc: Hoping to become a famous musician, a young Tibetan Mastiff leaves home to find a legendary and reclusive music artist. His innocent adventure sets off a series of unexpected events.

programme.title: The Canterville Ghost
programme.desc: Sir Simon de Canterville has been haunting the grounds of his country estate for more than 300 years, but he soon meets his match when he tries to scare off a modern-day American family that just moved in.

programme.title: A Tiger's Journey
programme.desc: In the valleys of the Himalayas, an orphan boy saves a Bengal tiger cub from the poachers who killed the creature's mother. Together they head for a monastery in Bhutan known as the Tiger's Nest, where Buddhist monks took refuge after the 1950 Chinese invasion of Tibet and protect the big cats. Drama, starring Sunny Pawar, Claudia Gerini and Amandeep Singh

programme.title: A Tiger's Tail
programme.desc: A tiger cub escapes from a wildlife sanctuary and follows a boy home. Initially delighted by his new pet, the youngster soon finds it is too much to handle, so with the aid of a friend and his faithful dog, he sets off on a journey to return the energetic big cat to its home. Family drama, starring Will Spencer and Greg Grunberg

programme.title: Patch Adams
programme.desc: A talented student doctor turns the medical community upside down with his offbeat views about the healing power of laughter. His methods provoke outrage and intense debate among his professors - but his extrovert nature brightens the lives of all kinds of patients. Comedy drama, starring Robin Williams, Monica Potter, Daniel London, Bob Gunton and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: The Cinema List: Family Favourites
programme.desc: Discover some of the very best Sky Originals to watch with the whole family, from Monster Family to The Amazing Maurice

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver

programme.title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl struggles to cope with the torments of growing up, fitting in and finding a boyfriend. Tired of being a social outcast, she plans to throw the perfect birthday party to win the respect of her peers. Comedy drama based on Louise Rennison's series of novels, starring Georgia Groome, Alan Davies, Karen Taylor and Aaron Taylor-Johnson

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons: Honour Among Thieves
programme.desc: Following the death of his wife, lute-playing bard Edgin abandons a noble pledge and turns to petty thievery with his surrogate sister, exiled barbarian Holga. The duo recruit self-doubting sorcerer Simon and incorrigible rogue Forge to their merry gang. A plan to steal the fabled Scroll of Reawakening backfires and Edgin is incarcerated with Holga on charges of grand larceny and skulduggery. Action adventure, starring Chris Pine, Michelle Rodriguez, Justice Smith, Sophia Lillis and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: In his quest for world domination, a power-mad Persian cat plots to sabotage a scientist's plans to cure all humans who are allergic to dogs. A heroic puppy joins a force of canine secret agents to foil his schemes. Comedy, starring Jeff Goldblum and Elizabeth Perkins, and featuring the voices of Tobey Maguire, Alec Baldwin, Susan Sarandon and Sean Hayes

programme.title: Hook
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Dungeons & Dragons: Honour Among Thieves
programme.desc: Following the death of his wife, lute-playing bard Edgin abandons a noble pledge and turns to petty thievery with his surrogate sister, exiled barbarian Holga. The duo recruit self-doubting sorcerer Simon and incorrigible rogue Forge to their merry gang. A plan to steal the fabled Scroll of Reawakening backfires and Edgin is incarcerated with Holga on charges of grand larceny and skulduggery. Action adventure, starring Chris Pine, Michelle Rodriguez, Justice Smith, Sophia Lillis and Hugh Grant

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: Unassuming hobbit Bilbo Baggins is pulled out of his comfortable life when Gandalf the wizard volunteers him for a dangerous quest. He joins a party of dwarves who are on a mission to reclaim their lost homeland, which has been taken over by a dragon. When the group journeys into the Misty Mountains, Bilbo becomes separated from the dwarves and falls into a cave, where he finds himself confronted by Gollum and forced to play a riddle game. It is set in Middle-earth 60 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and is the first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott, Cate Blanchett, Ian Holm and Christopher Lee

programme.title: A Tiger's Journey
programme.desc: In the valleys of the Himalayas, an orphan boy saves a Bengal tiger cub from the poachers who killed the creature's mother. Together they head for a monastery in Bhutan known as the Tiger's Nest, where Buddhist monks took refuge after the 1950 Chinese invasion of Tibet and protect the big cats. Drama, starring Sunny Pawar, Claudia Gerini and Amandeep Singh

programme.title: Patch Adams
programme.desc: A talented student doctor turns the medical community upside down with his offbeat views about the healing power of laughter. His methods provoke outrage and intense debate among his professors - but his extrovert nature brightens the lives of all kinds of patients. Comedy drama, starring Robin Williams, Monica Potter, Daniel London, Bob Gunton and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: Ghost Squad
programme.desc: A boy obsessed with the supernatural is dared by the brother of a girl he likes to spend Halloween night in a spooky house rumoured to be haunted. He and his two friends take up the challenge, only to find the stories are true when they encounter a terrifying ghostly dog. Fantasy adventure, starring Will Spencer, Cade Sutton and Phillip Wampler

programme.title: Beethoven's 2nd
programme.desc: The slobbering St Bernard is now grown up and in love with his beautiful sweetheart Missy. Together they bring a litter of puppies into the world - but have to go on the defensive when Missy's owner, the evil Regina, sets out to steal them for herself. Comedy sequel, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Chris Penn, Nicholle Tom and Christopher Castle

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver

programme.title: The Secret Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter and his younger sister Verity move into a new house and struggle to acclimatise to their surroundings in an emotionally unsettling period for their family. The children tumble into a cavernous space beneath their bedroom and are greeted by an army of pangolins, who decree Peter their ruler. Fantasy adventure, starring Sam Everingham and Alyla Browne

programme.title: Ghost Squad
programme.desc: A boy obsessed with the supernatural is dared by the brother of a girl he likes to spend Halloween night in a spooky house rumoured to be haunted. He and his two friends take up the challenge, only to find the stories are true when they encounter a terrifying ghostly dog. Fantasy adventure, starring Will Spencer, Cade Sutton and Phillip Wampler

programme.title: The Cinema List
programme.desc: Get comfy as we discover some of the best films to bring the family together with. From Men in Black to Barbie, there's something here for everyone!

programme.title: Pups United
programme.desc: A children's football team competes in a world championship, but one member is left off the field to look after the canine mascot. When an evil plot emerges to sabotage the tournament, the quick-witted dog assembles the other mascots into a team to foil the villains responsible. Family adventure, starring Matthew James Roberts and Kristin Carey, with the voice of Rob Schneider

programme.title: Beethoven's 2nd
programme.desc: The slobbering St Bernard is now grown up and in love with his beautiful sweetheart Missy. Together they bring a litter of puppies into the world - but have to go on the defensive when Missy's owner, the evil Regina, sets out to steal them for herself. Comedy sequel, starring Charles Grodin, Bonnie Hunt, Chris Penn, Nicholle Tom and Christopher Castle

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A hi-tech computer chip has a bizarre effect on a squad of toy soldiers, causing mayhem for their owner as the miniature marauders engage in a series of scaled-down skirmishes. Children's adventure mixing live action and computer animation, starring Kirsten Dunst, Denis Leary and Gregory Smith, with the voices of Tommy Lee Jones, Frank Langella, Sarah Michelle Gellar and Christina Ricci

programme.title: IF
programme.desc: A young girl called named Bea goes through a difficult time with her father and suddenly gains the ability to see imaginary friends (IFs). Bea learns her upstairs neighbour Cal also possesses the same power and they join forces to matchmake IFs with new children. Fantasy adventure, starring Ryan Reynolds and Cailey Fleming, with John Krasinski, who also wrote and directed

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: Unassuming hobbit Bilbo Baggins is pulled out of his comfortable life when Gandalf the wizard volunteers him for a dangerous quest. He joins a party of dwarves who are on a mission to reclaim their lost homeland, which has been taken over by a dragon. It is set in Middle-earth 60 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings and is the first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage, James Nesbitt, Ken Stott, Cate Blanchett, Ian Holm and Christopher Lee

programme.title: The Flintstones
programme.desc: Blue-collar caveman Fred Flintstone is promoted to an executive position at work and unwittingly becomes embroiled in an embezzlement scheme - thanks in no small part to his seductive new assistant. Live-action version of the cartoon comedy, starring John Goodman, Rick Moranis, Rosie O'Donnell, Halle Berry and Elizabeth Taylor

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski

programme.title: Shazam! Fury of the Gods
programme.desc: The Daughters of Atlas, aka Hespera, Kalypso and Anthea, arrive on Earth in search of stolen magic. The vengeful ancient gods threaten humanity, and the only brave souls standing in their destructive path are Shazam and his brightly costumed compatriots. Superhero sequel, starring Zachary Levi and Helen Mirren

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: Snatched from the Green Place of Many Mothers, young Furiosa gets caught in the crossfire of two tyrannical warlords. As the tyrants fight for dominance, Furiosa soon finds herself in a nonstop battle to make her way home.

programme.title: Twilight of the Warriors: Walled In
programme.desc: The notorious Kowloon Walled City serves as a fortified, lawless safe haven for gangs and refugees alike. But when a skilled underground fighter runs afoul of the most feared Triad boss in Hong Kong, a bounty is placed on his head.

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby and his dying mother. Her dreary life is interrupted when her schoolgirl crush arrives back in town.

programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.desc: When a couple begin to skip doses of an emotion-suppressing pill, they rediscover life in all its unfiltered glory. However, this also forces them to deal with the baggage that comes along.

programme.desc: 2022/2023 (GB: HAALAND). We take a look back at some of the most spectacular and important goals from previous Premier League seasons.

programme.title: 1-TO-11
programme.desc: EP12:. Former Premier League stars select their dream teams from the best they played with or against, guiding us through their picks with stories from on and off the pitch.

programme.title: GOALS OF THE SEASON
programme.desc: 2021/2022 (GB: SALAH & SON). We take a look back at some of the most spectacular and important goals from previous Premier League seasons.

programme.title: THE BIG INTERVIEW
programme.desc: EP26:. Extended sit-downs and more informal ‘out and about’ interviews with the Premier League’s biggest stars, providing players with a platform to tell their story in their own words.

programme.title: PL STORIES
programme.desc: EP36:. Our documentary strand showcasing the personalities who have shaped the Premier League era. Each episode will focus on the stories that engage fans and resonate with international audiences.

programme.title: GOALS OF THE SEASON
programme.desc: 2020/2021 (GB: KANE). We take a look back at some of the most spectacular and important goals from previous Premier League seasons.

programme.title: PL REWIND

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Under the leadership of Joe Torre, the Yankees, featuring Derek Jeter, Bernie Williams and Mariano Rivera, won three straight titles from 1998 to 2000 - winning a record 125 games in '98.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The New York Yankees advanced to the Fall Classic for the third time in four years, facing the Atlanta Braves who they defeated in the 1996 World Series. Mariano Rivera, Derek Jeter and Paul O'Neill led the Bronx Bombers to the Club's 25th championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The New York Yankees advanced to the Fall Classic for the third time in four years, facing the Atlanta Braves who they defeated in the 1996 World Series. Mariano Rivera, Derek Jeter and Paul O'Neill led the Bronx Bombers to the Club's 25th championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The 2000 World Series was the first all-New York Subway Series since the Yankees took on the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1956. And it didn't disappoint.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The Yankees seemed indestructible, winning 16 of 19 World Series games they had played over the previous five years. But the Diamondbacks - led by Curt Schilling and Randy Johnson - were unafraid of the pinstriped juggernaut.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Prior to the 2003 Fall Classic the two League Championship Series provided enough entertainment and drama to satisfy baseball fans across the globe. But the Marlins were singularly focused on completing their championship run.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: No, it's not a dream. In the 100th World Series ever played, the Boston Red Sox swept the St. Louis Cardinals to become World Series Champions. For 86 years, Red Sox fans cursed everything from their luck to Babe Ruth as they watched others celebrate.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: No, it's not a dream. In the 100th World Series ever played, the Boston Red Sox swept the St. Louis Cardinals to become World Series Champions. For 86 years, Red Sox fans cursed everything from their luck to Babe Ruth as they watched others celebrate.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Wire to wire. Only four teams in the history of the game had ever been in first place the entire regular season and won the World Series. Old School. Only one team in the last 50 years could lay claim to four consecutive complete games.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: It is, quite simply, the beauty of baseball. St. Louis beat San Diego in the NLDS and shocked the mighty Mets in the NLCS. In the World Series, they faced the heavily-favored Detroit Tigers team that had a week's worth of rest.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Red Sox Nation rejoiced as its beloved team reached the World Series in dramatic fashion, having just overcome a three-games-to-one deficit in the ALCS by outscoring the Cleveland Indians 30-5 in the final three contests. There they met the sizzling Colorado Rockies.

programme.title: MLB: Epic Moments
programme.desc: MLB Classics takes a look at one of the epic moments in the game's history, the emotions throughout the 2001 World Series.

programme.title: Major League Baseball
programme.desc: MLB classic action from the All-Star Highlights 1973 from the Royals Stadium in Kansas City.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The 2008 World Series is a competition between the Philadelphia Phillies and the Tampa Bay Rays.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: It was the matchup many had hoped for - the defending World Series champion Philadelphia Phillies against the team that had won more titles than any team in any sport: the New York Yankees.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The axiom that good pitching and timely hitting will win you a World Series title has been around as long as the Fall Classic has. But few teams ever proved that theory better than the World Series Champions, the San Francisco Giants.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: They believed. They wanted it. They overcame a 10.5-game deficit in late August and claimed a playoff berth on the final day of the regular season. They then conquered the Philadelphia Phillies and prevailed against the Milwaukee Brewers. Facing off next against the Texas Rangers, the St. Louis Cardinals fell behind 3-2 in the Fall Classic despite the unprecedented performance of Albert Pujols. But back at Busch Stadium, a Game 6 for the ages unfolded.
